plugins.name: C2O - Clutter to Organised
plugins.description:
C2O (Clutter to Organized) is a simple and effective Figma plugin that helps designers automatically arrange frames into a structured layout. If your Figma file feels cluttered, C2O will neatly organize everything in just one click.


✨ How It Works:

1️⃣ Rename your frames with a prefix inside square brackets.

Example:

[1a] Login Page (Row 1, Frame A)

[1b] Password Entry (Row 1, Frame B)

[2a] Dashboard (Row 2, Frame A)

2️⃣ Run the plugin and click "Organize Frames".

3️⃣ Your frames will be arranged into clearly structured groups, placed in order from top to bottom.

Frames without the naming pattern will be placed in an "Others" group at the bottom.


💡 Why Use C2O?

Eliminates manual alignment work and saves time.

Keeps designs structured and easy to navigate.

Improves team collaboration by maintaining a clean layout.

Click “Try it out” and bring order to your Figma files effortlessly! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Structure your Figma frames in One Click!

plugins.name: Adtraction Table Generator
plugins.description:
A specialized Figma plugin designed exclusively for Adtraction employees to streamline the process of converting complex Excel reports into presentation-ready Figma tables.


Key Features:

  1. 📊 Automatically splits large Excel files into separate tables
  2. 🎯 Purpose-built for Adtraction's reporting structure:
  3. Koncern (Group) tables
  4. Moderbolag (Parent company) tables
  5. Other financial data tables
  6. 🎨 Maintains Adtraction's brand typography with Lexend font
  7. 🔍 Preview tables before generation
  8. ⚡️ Bulk processing of multiple tables from a single Excel file
  9. 🔒 Local processing for data security


Perfect Use Case:

Designed specifically for Adtraction's quarterly and annual financial reporting workflow. When you have one large Excel file containing multiple tables of financial data, this plugin automatically:

  1. Identifies different table sections
  2. Splits them into separate tables
  3. Applies appropriate styling based on table type (koncern/moderbolag)
  4. Generates all tables with consistent formatting


Ideal for:

  1. Adtraction financial team members
  2. Corporate communications staff
  3. Anyone working with Adtraction's financial reports in Figma

This is a niche tool optimized for Adtraction's specific needs, making the process of converting financial Excel data into presentation-ready Figma tables quick and consistent.


Note: This plugin is primarily intended for Adtraction employees and is optimized for their internal Excel report format and brand guidelines.
plugins.tagline: Transform Adtraction Excel reports into perfectly formatted Figma tables  ✨

plugins.name: Text With Styles
plugins.description:
# Flutter Text Style Inspector


A powerful Figma plugin that bridges the gap between Figma text styles and Flutter's Material Design text theme system. This plugin helps developers and designers maintain consistency between Figma designs and Flutter implementations by automatically mapping Figma text styles to their corresponding Flutter TextTheme properties.


## Features


### Real-time Style Inspection

- Instantly view text style information for any selected text layer

- Live updates as you select different text elements

- Support for multiple text selection with smart duplicate filtering


### Comprehensive Style Information

- Displays the complete Figma text style name

- Shows associated color token information

- Previews the actual text content

- Automatically generates corresponding Flutter TextTheme code


### Smart Flutter Code Generation

- Automatically maps Figma text styles to Flutter's Material Design text theme

- Supports all standard Material text styles:

- Headlines (Large, Medium, Small)

- Titles (Large, Medium, Small)

- Body text (with weight variations)

- Labels (Large, Medium, Small)

- Includes font weight handling for body styles (w400, w500, w600)


### User-Friendly Interface

- Clean, organized display of style information

- Easy-to-copy Flutter code snippets

- Compact, floating UI that stays out of your way

- Simple click-outside-to-close functionality


## How to Use


1. Select any text layer(s) in your Figma design

2. The plugin will automatically display:

- The applied Figma text style

- The color token (if available)

- A preview of the text content

- The equivalent Flutter TextTheme code

3. Copy the generated Flutter code directly into your application


## Best Practices


- Name your Figma text styles to match Material Design conventions for automatic mapping

- Use consistent style names to ensure accurate Flutter code generation

- Apply color styles to text layers for complete token information

- Select multiple text layers to quickly inspect all text styles in a component


Perfect for teams working with both Figma and Flutter, this plugin streamlines the handoff process and ensures design consistency across platforms.
plugins.tagline: Select any layer and get its texts with styles

plugins.name: Behind the frame
plugins.description:
Опис﻿ание

Случаются ситуации, когда объекты оказываются за фреймами и вы не знаете какие из них. Как бы вы их не нашли, при большом количестве фреймов поместить их в нужный в панели слоев не самое простое занятие, а вынести за пределы и снова внутрь не гарантирует поместить на тоже место. Этот плагин упрощает это действие.


Select all out-of-frame objects

Selects all objects that are out of frames.


Objects in frames

Places all selected objects in the frames above them.

  1. Select the objects along with the frames and run the script.
  2. All selected objects will end up in the frames they visually match.


Выбрать всё вне фреймов

Выбирает все объекты которые находятся вне фреймов.


Объекты во фреймы

Помещает все выделенные объекты во фреймы над которыми находятся.

  1. Выделите объекты вместе с фреймами и запустите скрипт.
  2. Все выделенные объекты окажутся во фреймах с которыми совпадают визуально.
plugins.tagline: In order to place objects that are behind frames into frames

plugins.name: CSS Variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Import css variables into Figma variables

This plugin enables you import color variables from CSS into Figma, supporting both single-mode and dual Light/Dark mode setups. It maps your CSS variables to Figma's variable modes, converting formats like OKLCH (Tailwind), HEX, RGBA, and RGB into Figma-compatible HEX values. OKLCH, P3, and HCT color values are also preserved and attached to each variable for reference.


Example:


.light {
--color-primary: #000;
}
.dark {
--color-primary: #fff;
}


How it works:

  1. Paste your CSS variables in the text area below.
  2. Click "Export to JSON" to generate a Figma-compatible variables file.
  3. Import the JSON file into Figma using the Figma Variables by Honza Toman


Watch video→ how it works.


Currently supported:

  1. Color variables
  2. Attach oklch, p3 colors and HCT values to variable syntax


Next updates:

  1. Border radius variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Shadows
  4. ...


Feedback and support

  1. Let us know your feedback and suggestions! @sans_sherif
  2. Support the development of this plugin buy us a coffee ☕
plugins.tagline: Import existing css variables to figma variables

plugins.name: Calculator
plugins.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figma’s native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
plugins.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

127100.release_notes:

Improved handling of thousand separators (1,000 and 1.000)
Better detection of decimal points vs thousand separators
Support for both European (1.234,56) and American (1,234.56) number formats
Currency Support:
Added recognition of currency symbols ($, €, £, ₴, ¥, ₿)
Support for currency codes (USD, EUR, GBP, UAH, JPY, BTC, ETH, USDT)

plugins.name: Ai Design Review
plugins.description:
Transform Your Design Process with AI-powered Insights


Ai Design Review is a cutting-edge Figma plugin designed to help designers optimize their work by providing AI-driven design reviews. With this plugin, you can instantly analyze your designs and receive suggestions for improvement based on best practices in typography, layout, color schemes, accessibility, and overall visual consistency.


By utilizing AI technology, Ai Design Review helps you ensure that your designs adhere to industry standards, making your workflow more efficient and your designs more polished. The plugin automatically scans your design file, analyzes it against key design principles, and highlights potential issues, offering actionable insights and suggestions to improve the design's quality and user experience.


Whether you're a solo designer or part of a design team, Ai Design Review will serve as your AI assistant, providing real-time feedback to enhance your design’s impact and usability.


Key Features:

Automated Design Analysis: Instantly scan your designs for inconsistencies, color imbalances, accessibility issues, and more.


AI-Driven Recommendations: Receive intelligent suggestions for design improvements tailored to your project.


Customizable Feedback: Choose the types of design elements you want to receive feedback on, such as typography, spacing, or color.


Efficient Workflow: Save time and enhance collaboration by automatically detecting and fixing common design mistakes.


Boost your design efficiency and improve your work with Ai Design Review — your AI-powered design assistant.
plugins.tagline: Enhance your designs with AI-powered insights for better quality and consistency

plugins.name: Jam Session
plugins.description:
Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.

Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.


Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyz


How to use

  1. Start a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.
  2. Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.
  3. Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.


Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.

  1. Keeps the fun alive in workshops
  2. Avoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participants
  3. Gives you control of how submissions appear


Jam Session is in public beta.

A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

accepted.name: dano
accepted.description: i do design and design activities

plugins.tagline: Join FigJam activities from anywhere! Run sessions anybody can join from any device.

plugins.name: 角落艺术家
plugins.description:
In the new version of "Corner Artist," I've added a language switch feature between Chinese and English. Here, you can freely switch to your preferred language as needed.


The new version optimizes the user experience, making the overall UI more refined and convenient.


By clicking the button, you can randomly switch to your favorite gradient colors.

Additionally, the new version introduces a "Random Corner Radius" feature, allowing you to choose the layer you want to modify and adjust the corner radius strength.


Here, the higher the value, the smaller the corner radius strength.


I’ve used the superellipse corner radius formula:

|x/a|^n + |y/b|^n = 1

When n = 2, it’s a regular ellipse;

When n < 2, it’s a superellipse;

The smaller the value of n, the closer the corners are to right angles.


For those interested, you can explore the formula on your own; I’ll post it in the comments.

When you choose a corner radius strength less than 1, you'll also receive stars as a bonus.


That's about it for the new features. Feel free to experience and save them!
plugins.tagline: Making the overall UI more refined and convenient.

Select the instances you want to apply the export settings from a main component in a library for, and select this command.


Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.

plugins.name: Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless
plugins.description:
Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless

This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design system variables and Penpot's design tokens, allowing seamless migration of your local variables.


How It Works

The plugin connects to Figma's Variables API to extract local variable collections and transform them into Penpot's token format. Here's the process:


  1. Collection Discovery: Upon launch, the plugin scans your Figma file for all variable collections and presents them in a selectable list.
  2. Intelligent Mapping: The converter handles various Figma variable types (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) and maps them to Penpot's token system, including:
  3. Variable mode conversion to Penpot themes
  4. Proper handling of variable references
  5. Special formatting of colors (HEX and RGBA)
  6. Nested structure preservation
  7. Token Organization: The plugin creates a structured Penpot token JSON with:
  8. Themes based on your variable collections and modes
  9. Proper metadata for Penpot compatibility
  10. Dependency management between collections
  11. Clean Output: The result is a downloadable JSON file ready to be imported into Penpot's design system.


Something is not working or you have suggestion for new feature? Submit feedback


🎉 Bonus: Publish your designs directly to websites with Detachless – no coding needed! 💻🌐

plugins.name: Feature-Labeler
plugins.description:
Create numbered badges and description frames for your wireframes with ease. Streamline your design documentation process by adding sequential numbered references to features and their explanations. Convenient for product specifications, user flow documentation, and design handoffs.


  1. Create a Number Badge
  2. Select the badge size (small, medium, or large)
  3. Choose a color from preset options or use the color picker
  4. Click "Create" to add a numbered badge to your design
  5. Create a Description Frame
  6. Select the frame size (small, medium, or large)
  7. Click "Create" to add a description frame with a matching number
  8. Edit Badges and Descriptions
  9. Click on any badge or description frame to edit
  10. Change numbers to reorder the sequence automatically
  11. For badges, you can also update the color
  12. Organize Documentation
  13. Place badges next to UI elements you want to reference
  14. Add explanatory text in the description frames
  15. Badges and descriptions with the same number are linked in the sequence


와이어프레임에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지와 설명 프레임을 쉽게 생성하세요. 기능과 설명에 순차적인 번호 참조를 추가하여 디자인 문서화 프로세스를 간소화합니다. 제품 사양, 사용자 플로우 문서화 및 디자인 인계에 편리하게 활용할 수 있습니다.


  1. 번호 뱃지 만들기
  2. 뱃지 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  3. 미리 설정된 색상 중에서 선택하거나 색상 선택기 사용
  4. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 디자인에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지 추가
  5. 설명 프레임 만들기
  6. 프레임 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  7. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 일치하는 번호의 설명 프레임 추가
  8. 뱃지 및 설명 편집
  9. 편집하려는 뱃지나 설명 프레임을 클릭
  10. 번호를 변경하면 시퀀스가 자동으로 재정렬됨
  11. 뱃지의 경우 색상도 업데이트 가능
  12. 문서 정리
  13. 참조하려는 UI 요소 옆에 뱃지 배치
  14. 설명 프레임에 설명 텍스트 추가
  15. 같은 번호의 뱃지와 설명은 시퀀스에서 연결됨
plugins.tagline: Simplify wireframe annotations with numbered badges and descriptions

plugins.name: AdaptaFont—Intelligent Font Scaling for Seamless Multi-Format Scenarios
plugins.description:
1. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Image Dimension Requirements

Automatically adjusts text font size by modifying the fixed width and line count parameters according to different image dimension needs (e.g., designs for multiple e-commerce platforms), enabling rapid completion of typesetting in such scenarios.


2. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Language Requirements

Through configuring font family, font weight, and line height settings, the plugin automatically adjusts font sizes for text content in various languages to adapt to the preset text width and line count, thereby quickly fulfilling typesetting requirements for globalized designs.


Features:


⌨️ Methods to Obtain Text:

Designers can acquire text content requiring adaptive font sizes either by selecting text nodes or inputting/pasting new text in the plugin's input field.


🔄 Reacquire Text Content & Text Properties:

Designers can click the refresh button to reacquire the text content, font, font weight, and line height of selected text layers on the canvas for further adjustments and optimization.


👀 Predict Actual Line Count:

The plugin features actual line count prediction capability, forecasting real line numbers based on current text content and settings to help designers better plan text layout.


↙️ Window Scaling:

The plugin window can be minimized by collapsing setting items, proving highly efficient in scenarios requiring rapid multi-language text replacement using identical text properties.


🎨 Theme Switching & Language Toggling

Switch between light/dark themes

Instant Chinese/English interface language switching


---

1. 不同图片尺寸需求的文本字号自适应

根据不同的图片尺寸需求，通过调整文本的固定宽度及行数，自动调整文本的字号，快速完成在如多电商平台的设计中排版。


2. 不同语言需求的文本字号自适应

插件通过设置字体、字重、行高，自动调整各个语言下文本内容的字号来适配设置好的文本宽度和行数，以此来快速完成全球化设计的排版需求。


功能：


⌨️ 获取文本的方式

设计师可以通过选择文本节点，或者在插件输入框中输入或粘贴新文本来获取需要自适应字号的文本内容。


🔄 重新获取文本内容与文本属性

设计师可点击刷新按钮，重新获取画布中已选中的文本图层的文本内容、字体、字重和行高，以便进一步的调整和优化。


👀 预测实际行数

插件具备实际行数预测功能，能够根据当前文本内容和设置，预测实际的行数，帮助设计师更好地规划文本的排版。


↙️ 窗口缩放

可通过折叠设置项来缩小插件窗口，这在使用同一套文本属性的多语言文本快速替换场景下十分高效。


🎨 主题切换与中英文切换
plugins.tagline: AdaptaFont auto-sizes text in Figma by width, line height & max lines.

plugins.name: Data Bloom
plugins.description:
Data Bloom is your go-to plugin for breathing life into your Figma designs. Easily replace generic dummy text with real-looking, localized content and user data tailored to your audience. Now supporting 10 languages with 10+ data type options (see below), Data Bloom will continue expanding to include more languages and data types.


Supported languages:

🇦🇿 Azerbaijani, 🇺🇸 English (USA), 🇩🇪 German, 🇰🇿 Kazakh, 🇰🇬 Kyrgyz, 🇷🇺 Russian, 🇹🇷 Turkish, 🇹🇲 Turkmen, 🇺🇦 Ukrainian, 🇺🇿 Uzbek


Available data types:

🎲 Random: Generates a data point by randomly selecting from any of the other available data types.

👫🏻 Names: Creates realistic first names, last names, or full names, with options for gender.

🤪 Playful Usernames: Produces fun and quirky usernames, optionally starting with an "@" symbol.

📞 Phone Numbers: Generates phone numbers with various formatting options, including country-specific domestic styles.

💳 Payment card details: Helps to generate mock payment card information, such as Card numbers, Expiry date and CVV/CVC

⭐️ Ratings and reviews: Generate localized generic review text from categories like "General", "Product specific" or "App feedback"

📆 Date: Creates date values with customizable formats and selectable year ranges, including custom inputs.

📆 Days of the week: Inserts day names (e.g., Monday, Tuesday)

📆 Months: Populates layers with month names (e.g., January, February)

💼 Professions: Populates layers with a diverse list of job titles and occupations.

🎨 Colors: Replaces selected text layers with common color names.


Whether you’re designing a prototype or building a demo, Data Bloom makes it effortless to populate text layers in seconds, ensuring your prototypes feel authentic, personalized, and polished.


✦ Lightning-fast generation

✦ Realistic, localized data (Names, Phone Numbers, Colors, Usernames and Professions)

✦ Lightweight and Figma-friendly

✦ Continuous updates with new languages and data types


Replace “lorem ipsum” forever — grow your designs with Data Bloom.


🌱 How-to Guide:

  1. Run the Data Bloom plugin.
  2. Select one or multiple text layers in your design where you want to insert random data.
  3. Choose a preferred data language and data type from the list.
  4. Click “Generate Data” and the plugin will instantly populate the selected text layers based on your set preferences.

plugins.name: Big-Tech Style Design Challenges
plugins.description:
✨ Figma Plugin Description

Practice real-world design challenges directly inside Figma.

Sharpen your product thinking and UX skills with guided prompts and exercises — perfect for designers prepping for interviews or just looking to stay sharp.


🌐 What is Designus?

When you submit your solution via the plugin, your work gets published to the Designus platform — where you can explore other designers' answers and learn from diverse approaches.

Use the plugin to focus on solving the challenge, and head to the website to review and reflect on submitted solutions.


🛠 How to Use the Plugin

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Choose a challenge from the calendar
  3. Click Import to add the challenge & solution frame to your canvas
  4. Design your solution directly inside Figma
  5. Reopen the plugin and go to Export Solution
  6. Select your solution frame and write a short description
  7. Click Export to submit your answer
  8. Go to Designus website to review your submission and check out others' solutions.
plugins.tagline: Design Challenges - Level up your design skills through real design challenges.
